p: The findings obtained in the present work showed that hydroethanol, n-butanol, and polyphenol-rich fractions from C. europaeas showed an important anti-inflammatory effect. The observed inflammatory effect can be due to benzoic acid and isoparvifuran compounds identified in the n-butanol fraction chemically characterized by GC-MS ( Figure 3 and Table 3). Benzoic acid derivatives were found to have a potent effect to inhibit cyclo-oxygenase activity. Consequently, these chemicals can act as anti-inflammatory agents and can be used to treat various inflammatory disorders [ 17, 18]. Isoparvifuran and flavones compounds displayed potent anti-inflammatory activity as reported elsewhere [ 19, 20, 21].
